content.description:
Tune1 hinc spoliisspolium, -i, n.: spoils (of war) indute meorum 
eripiare mihi? Pallas te hoc vulnere, Pallas 
immolatimmolo, -are: to sacrifice et poenam sceleratosceleratus, -a, -um, adj. = scelestus, -a, -um ex sanguine sumit.
 1:Tu here refers to Turnus.↩
content.question: In line 1, spoliis indute meorum is translated

choices.label: put on the spoils, my men
clothed in the spoils of my men

content.answer: clothed in the spoils of my men

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
